alert.note: Alert for Outagamie (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 1:18PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT OUTAGAMIE COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM CDT... At 117 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New London, or 15 miles west of Appleton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Appleton, Kaukauna, Little Chute, New London, Kimberly, Black Creek, Darboy, Oneida, Greenville, Combined Locks, Dale, Hortonville, Medina, Shiocton, Freedom, Mackville, Murphy Corner, Chicago Corners, Stephensville, and Twelve Corners. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
